Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - NameError: 'page_text_lower' is not defined. The code successfully downloaded both Wikipedia pages (status 200) but crashed during content analysis due to a variable naming inconsistency. Looking at the **CURRENT CODE**, the issue is on line 73 where 'page_text_lower' is referenced in the album content check, but the variable was actually defined as 'content_text_lower' in the **HISTORY** attempts. This creates a mismatch where the code tries to use 'page_text_lower' but only defines variables with different names. **PLAN** alignment: 10% - downloads completed but 0% album research performed due to the variable error blocking all subsequent analysis. The **PLAN** requires comprehensive album research with structured data output for both Fiona Apple and Paula Cole before 1999, but this naming inconsistency stops execution before any album data can be extracted. Recommended fix: Ensure consistent variable naming throughout the code - check line 73 and make sure all variable references match the actual variable definitions (use either 'page_text_lower' consistently or rename the definition to match the usage).
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from datetime import datetime # Create workspace directory if it doesn't exist if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE ALBUM RESEARCH (PRE-1999) ===") print("Objective: Find all albums released by both artists before 1999") print("Focus: Studio albums and major releases with critical recognition\n") # Set up headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Target artists and their Wikipedia pages target_artists = { 'Fiona Apple': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple', 'Paula Cole': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Cole' } print("Step 1: Accessing Wikipedia pages for both artists...\n") # Store results for each artist successful_downloads = [] failed_downloads = [] # Download Wikipedia pages for each artist for artist_name, wikipedia_url in target_artists.items(): print(f"Accessing {artist_name}'s Wikipedia page...") print(f"URL: {wikipedia_url}") try: response = requests.get(wikipedia_url, headers=headers, timeout=20) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: print(f"âœ“ Successfully accessed {artist_name}'s page") # Save the HTML content filename = f"{artist_name.lower().replace(' ', '_')}_wikipedia.html" filepath = f'workspace/{filename}' with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) # FIXED: Consistent variable naming throughout soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') title_element = soup.find('title') page_title = title_element.get_text().strip() if title_element else 'No title found' # Get page text content with consistent naming page_text = soup.get_text() page_text_lower = page_text.lower() # Look for discography/album related content album_keywords = ['discography', 'album', 'studio album', 'debut', 'released'] has_album_content = any(keyword in page_text_lower for keyword in album_keywords) # Look for years in our target range (before 1999) target_years_found = [] for year in range(1990, 1999): if str(year) in page_text: target_years_found.append(str(year)) artist_info = { 'name': artist_name, 'wikipedia_url': wikipedia_url, 'title': page_title, 'filename': filepath, 'has_discography_info': has_album_content, 'content_length': len(response.text), 'target_years_found': target_years_found } successful_downloads.append(artist_info) print(f" Title: {page_title}") print(f" Content length: {len(response.text):,} characters") print(f" Contains discography info: {has_album_content}") print(f" Pre-1999 years found: {target_years_found}") else: failed_downloads.append({'artist': artist_name, 'url': wikipedia_url, 'status': response.status_code}) print(f"âœ— Failed to access {artist_name}'s page - Status: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: failed_downloads.append({'artist': artist_name, 'url': wikipedia_url, 'error': str(e)}) print(f"âœ— Error accessing {artist_name}'s page: {str(e)}") print() # Add spacing between artists time.sleep(2) # Be respectful to servers print(f"=== INITIAL ACCESS RESULTS ===") print(f"Successfully accessed: {len(successful_downloads)} artist pages") print(f"Failed to access: {len(failed_downloads)} artist pages") if failed_downloads: print("\nFailed downloads:") for failure in failed_downloads: print(f" - {failure['artist']}: {failure.get('status', failure.get('error'))}") # Analyze successful downloads for album information if successful_downloads: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING ARTIST PAGES FOR ALBUM INFORMATION ===\n") albums_found = [] for artist_info in successful_downloads: artist_name = artist_info['name'] filepath = artist_info['filename'] print(f"Analyzing {artist_name}'s Wikipedia page...") print(f"File: {filepath}") with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Look for discography sections print(f"\nSearching for discography sections...") discography_sections = [] headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) for heading in headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().lower() if any(word in heading_text for word in ['discography', 'albums', 'studio albums', 'career']): discography_sections.append({ 'heading': heading.get_text().strip(), 'level': heading.name, 'element': heading }) print(f"Found {len(discography_sections)} discography-related sections:") for section in discography_sections: print(f" - {section['level'].upper()}: {section['heading']}") # Look for tables that might contain album information print(f"\nAnalyzing tables for album data...") tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Found {len(tables)} tables in the page") album_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(tables): table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Check if table contains album/year information has_pre_1999_years = False for year in range(1990, 1999): if str(year) in table_text: has_pre_1999_years = True break has_album_indicators = any(word in table_text for word in ['album', 'title', 'year', 'studio', 'released', 'debut']) if has_pre_1999_years and has_album_indicators: album_tables.append({ 'index': i, 'element': table, 'has_target_years': has_pre_1999_years }) print(f" Table {i+1}: Contains album/year data - *** POTENTIAL DISCOGRAPHY TABLE ***") # Extract table headers for analysis table_headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in table_headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts}") else: print(f" Table {i+1}: General content") # Extract album information from promising tables print(f"\nExtracting album data from {len(album_tables)} potential album tables...") artist_albums = [] for table_info in album_tables: table = table_info['element'] table_index = table_info['index'] print(f"\n Processing Table {table_index + 1}:") rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Total rows: {len(rows)}") # Process each row to extract album information for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows[1:], 1): # Skip header row cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) if len(cells) >= 2: # Need at least 2 columns for meaningful data cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts) # Look for years in our target range (1990-1998) target_years_in_row = [] for year in range(1990, 1999): if str(year) in row_text: target_years_in_row.append(year) if target_years_in_row: print(f"\n Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Try to identify album title and type potential_album_info = { 'artist': artist_name, 'table_index': table_index + 1, 'row_index': row_idx, 'years_found': target_years_in_row, 'cell_data': cell_texts, 'full_text': row_text } # Determine if this is a studio album row_text_lower = row_text.lower() studio_indicators = ['studio album', 'album', 'debut album', 'lp'] live_indicators = ['live', 'concert', 'tour'] compilation_indicators = ['compilation', 'greatest hits', 'best of', 'collection'] is_studio_album = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in studio_indicators) is_live_album = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in live_indicators) is_compilation = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in compilation_indicators) # Extract album title candidates potential_titles = [] for cell_text in cell_texts: # Skip cells that are just years, very short, or contain only numbers/dates cell_clean = cell_text.strip() if (len(cell_clean) > 4 and cell_clean not in [str(y) for y in range(1990, 1999)] and not cell_clean.isdigit() and '/' not in cell_clean and not cell_clean.startswith('19')): potential_titles.append(cell_clean) potential_album_info.update({ 'is_studio_album': is_studio_album, 'is_live_album': is_live_album, 'is_compilation': is_compilation, 'potential_titles': potential_titles }) print(f" Years: {target_years_in_row}") print(f" Potential titles: {potential_titles}") print(f" Studio album: {is_studio_album}") print(f" Live album: {is_live_album}") print(f" Compilation: {is_compilation}") # Filter for studio albums and major releases if (is_studio_album or (not is_live_album and not is_compilation and len(potential_titles) > 0)): print(f" *** IDENTIFIED AS ALBUM ***") artist_albums.append(potential_album_info) albums_found.append(potential_album_info) # Search for well-known albums in the main text print(f"\nSearching for well-known albums in main text...") main_text = soup.get_text() # Known albums for these artists in the pre-1999 period known_albums = { 'Fiona Apple': [ ('Tidal', 1996) ], 'Paula Cole': [ ('Harbinger', 1994), ('This Fire', 1996) ] } if artist_name in known_albums: for album_title, expected_year in known_albums[artist_name]: # Look for mentions of these known albums if album_title.lower() in main_text.lower() and str(expected_year) in main_text: # Check if we already found this album in tables already_found = False for existing_album in artist_albums: existing_titles = [t.lower() for t in existing_album['potential_titles']] if album_title.lower() in existing_titles: already_found = True break if not already_found: print(f" Found known album in text: {album_title} ({expected_year})") text_album = { 'artist': artist_name, 'table_index': 0, # Text source 'row_index': 0, 'years_found': [expected_year], 'cell_data': [album_title, str(expected_year)], 'full_text': f'{album_title} {expected_year}', 'is_studio_album': True, 'is_live_album': False, 'is_compilation': False, 'potential_titles': [album_title] } artist_albums.append(text_album) albums_found.append(text_album) print(f"\nTotal albums found for {artist_name}: {len(artist_albums)}") for album in artist_albums: album_title = album['potential_titles'][0] if album['potential_titles'] else 'Unknown' album_year = min(album['years_found']) if album['years_found'] else 'Unknown year' print(f" - {album_title} ({album_year})") print(f"\n{'='*60}") print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ALBUM EXTRACTION RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Total albums found across both artists: {len(albums_found)}") # Process and clean up the album data processed_albums = [] for album in albums_found: year = min(album['years_found']) if album['years_found'] else None title = album['potential_titles'][0] if album['potential_titles'] else 'Title needs verification' # Clean up title title = title.strip() # Remove surrounding quotes if present if (title.startswith('"') and title.endswith('"')) or (title.startswith("'") and title.endswith("'")): title = title[1:-1] processed_album = { 'artist': album['artist'], 'title': title, 'year': year, 'all_potential_titles': album['potential_titles'], 'source_table': album['table_index'], 'source_row': album['row_index'], 'classification_confidence': 'high' if album['is_studio_album'] else 'medium', 'raw_data': album['cell_data'] } processed_albums.append(processed_album) # Sort albums by artist and year processed_albums.sort(key=lambda x: (x['artist'], x['year'] or 0)) print("=== PROCESSED ALBUMS LIST ===\n") current_artist = None for album in processed_albums: if album['artist'] != current_artist: current_artist = album['artist'] print(f"\n{current_artist}:") print("-" * len(current_artist)) confidence_indicator = "ðŸŸ¢" if album['classification_confidence'] == 'high' else "ðŸŸ¡" year_display = album['year'] if album['year'] else 'Year TBD' print(f"{confidence_indicator} {year_display}: {album['title']}") if len(album['all_potential_titles']) > 1: other_titles = [t for t in album['all_potential_titles'] if t != album['title']] print(f" Alt titles: {', '.join(other_titles)}") # Create final structured results final_results = { 'research_objective': 'Albums by Fiona Apple and Paula Cole released before 1999', 'research_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'artists_researched': list(target_artists.keys()), 'total_albums_found': len(processed_albums), 'albums_by_artist': {}, 'complete_album_list': processed_albums, 'methodology': { 'sources': 'Wikipedia discography sections and tables', 'year_filter': 'Released before 1999 (1990-1998)', 'album_types': 'Studio albums and major releases', 'extraction_method': 'HTML table parsing with known album verification' } } # Group albums by artist for album in processed_albums: artist = album['artist'] if artist not in final_results['albums_by_artist']: final_results['albums_by_artist'][artist] = [] final_results['albums_by_artist'][artist].append({ 'title': album['title'], 'year': album['year'], 'confidence': album['classification_confidence'] }) # Save results to workspace with open('workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_albums_pre_1999.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== RESEARCH SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Artists researched: {', '.join(target_artists.keys())}") print(f"Total albums found: {len(processed_albums)}") print(f"Time period: Before 1999 (1990-1998)") print(f"Focus: Studio albums and major releases") for artist, albums in final_results['albums_by_artist'].items(): print(f"\n{artist}: {len(albums)} albums") for album in albums: print(f" â€¢ {album['year']}: {album['title']} ({album['confidence']} confidence)") print(f"\nResults saved to: workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_albums_pre_1999.json") else: print("\nNo artist pages successfully downloaded. Cannot proceed with album extraction.") print(f"\n=== RESEARCH PHASE 1 COMPLETE ===") print(f"Next steps: Verify album details and enhance data quality if needed")
Execution Output
Code Output: === FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE ALBUM RESEARCH (PRE-1999) === Objective: Find all albums released by both artists before 1999 Focus: Studio albums and major releases with critical recognition Step 1: Accessing Wikipedia pages for both artists... Accessing Fiona Apple's Wikipedia page... URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple Response status: 200 âœ“ Successfully accessed Fiona Apple's page âœ— Error accessing Fiona Apple's page: name 'page_text_lower' is not defined âœ— No snapshots in response Accessing Paula Cole's Wikipedia page... URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Cole Checking 2021-04-20... Response status: 200 âœ“ Successfully accessed Paula Cole's page âœ— Error accessing Paula Cole's page: name 'page_text_lower' is not defined === INITIAL ACCESS RESULTS === Successfully accessed: 0 artist pages Failed to access: 2 artist pages Failed downloads: - Fiona Apple: name 'page_text_lower' is not defined - Paula Cole: name 'page_text_lower' is not defined No artist pages successfully downloaded. 2025-08-03 04:48:19
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 10)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from datetime import datetime # Create workspace directory if it doesn't exist if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE ALBUM RESEARCH (PRE-1999) ===") print("Objective: Find all albums released by both artists before 1999") print("Focus: Studio albums and major releases with critical recognition\n") # Set up headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Target artists and their Wikipedia pages target_artists = { 'Fiona Apple': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple', 'Paula Cole': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Cole' } print("Step 1: Accessing Wikipedia pages for both artists...\n") # Store results for each artist successful_downloads = [] failed_downloads = [] # Download Wikipedia pages for each artist for artist_name, wikipedia_url in target_artists.items(): print(f"Accessing {artist_name}'s Wikipedia page...") print(f"URL: {wikipedia_url}") try: response = requests.get(wikipedia_url, headers=headers, timeout=20) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: print(f"âœ“ Successfully accessed {artist_name}'s page") # Save the HTML content filename = f"{artist_name.lower().replace(' ', '_')}_wikipedia.html" filepath = f'workspace/{filename}' with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) # FIXED: Simple and consistent content analysis soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') title_element = soup.find('title') page_title = title_element.get_text().strip() if title_element else 'No title found' # Get page text content - CONSISTENT NAMING full_page_text = soup.get_text() lowercase_text = full_page_text.lower() # Look for discography/album related content album_keywords = ['discography', 'album', 'studio album', 'debut', 'released'] has_album_content = any(keyword in lowercase_text for keyword in album_keywords) # Look for years in our target range (before 1999) target_years_found = [] for year in range(1990, 1999): if str(year) in full_page_text: target_years_found.append(str(year)) artist_info = { 'name': artist_name, 'wikipedia_url': wikipedia_url, 'title': page_title, 'filename': filepath, 'has_discography_info': has_album_content, 'content_length': len(response.text), 'target_years_found': target_years_found } successful_downloads.append(artist_info) print(f" Title: {page_title}") print(f" Content length: {len(response.text):,} characters") print(f" Contains discography info: {has_album_content}") print(f" Pre-1999 years found: {target_years_found}") else: failed_downloads.append({'artist': artist_name, 'url': wikipedia_url, 'status': response.status_code}) print(f"âœ— Failed to access {artist_name}'s page - Status: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: failed_downloads.append({'artist': artist_name, 'url': wikipedia_url, 'error': str(e)}) print(f"âœ— Error accessing {artist_name}'s page: {str(e)}") print() # Add spacing between artists time.sleep(2) # Be respectful to servers print(f"=== INITIAL ACCESS RESULTS ===") print(f"Successfully accessed: {len(successful_downloads)} artist pages") print(f"Failed to access: {len(failed_downloads)} artist pages") if failed_downloads: print("\nFailed downloads:") for failure in failed_downloads: print(f" - {failure['artist']}: {failure.get('status', failure.get('error'))}") # Analyze successful downloads for album information if successful_downloads: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING ARTIST PAGES FOR ALBUM INFORMATION ===\n") albums_found = [] for artist_info in successful_downloads: artist_name = artist_info['name'] filepath = artist_info['filename'] print(f"Analyzing {artist_name}'s Wikipedia page...") print(f"File: {filepath}") with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Look for discography sections print(f"\nSearching for discography sections...") discography_sections = [] headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) for heading in headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().lower() if any(word in heading_text for word in ['discography', 'albums', 'studio albums', 'career']): discography_sections.append({ 'heading': heading.get_text().strip(), 'level': heading.name, 'element': heading }) print(f"Found {len(discography_sections)} discography-related sections:") for section in discography_sections: print(f" - {section['level'].upper()}: {section['heading']}") # Look for tables that might contain album information print(f"\nAnalyzing tables for album data...") tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Found {len(tables)} tables in the page") album_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(tables): table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Check if table contains album/year information has_pre_1999_years = False for year in range(1990, 1999): if str(year) in table_text: has_pre_1999_years = True break has_album_indicators = any(word in table_text for word in ['album', 'title', 'year', 'studio', 'released', 'debut']) if has_pre_1999_years and has_album_indicators: album_tables.append({ 'index': i, 'element': table, 'has_target_years': has_pre_1999_years }) print(f" Table {i+1}: Contains album/year data - *** POTENTIAL DISCOGRAPHY TABLE ***") # Extract table headers for analysis table_headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in table_headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts}") else: print(f" Table {i+1}: General content") # Extract album information from promising tables print(f"\nExtracting album data from {len(album_tables)} potential album tables...") artist_albums = [] for table_info in album_tables: table = table_info['element'] table_index = table_info['index'] print(f"\n Processing Table {table_index + 1}:") rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Total rows: {len(rows)}") # Process each row to extract album information for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows[1:], 1): # Skip header row cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) if len(cells) >= 2: # Need at least 2 columns for meaningful data cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts) # Look for years in our target range (1990-1998) target_years_in_row = [] for year in range(1990, 1999): if str(year) in row_text: target_years_in_row.append(year) if target_years_in_row: print(f"\n Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Try to identify album title and type potential_album_info = { 'artist': artist_name, 'table_index': table_index + 1, 'row_index': row_idx, 'years_found': target_years_in_row, 'cell_data': cell_texts, 'full_text': row_text } # Determine if this is a studio album row_text_lower = row_text.lower() studio_indicators = ['studio album', 'album', 'debut album', 'lp'] live_indicators = ['live', 'concert', 'tour'] compilation_indicators = ['compilation', 'greatest hits', 'best of', 'collection'] is_studio_album = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in studio_indicators) is_live_album = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in live_indicators) is_compilation = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in compilation_indicators) # Extract album title candidates potential_titles = [] for cell_text in cell_texts: # Skip cells that are just years, very short, or contain only numbers/dates cell_clean = cell_text.strip() if (len(cell_clean) > 4 and cell_clean not in [str(y) for y in range(1990, 1999)] and not cell_clean.isdigit() and '/' not in cell_clean and not cell_clean.startswith('19')): potential_titles.append(cell_clean) potential_album_info.update({ 'is_studio_album': is_studio_album, 'is_live_album': is_live_album, 'is_compilation': is_compilation, 'potential_titles': potential_titles }) print(f" Years: {target_years_in_row}") print(f" Potential titles: {potential_titles}") print(f" Studio album: {is_studio_album}") print(f" Live album: {is_live_album}") print(f" Compilation: {is_compilation}") # Filter for studio albums and major releases if (is_studio_album or (not is_live_album and not is_compilation and len(potential_titles) > 0)): print(f" *** IDENTIFIED AS ALBUM ***") artist_albums.append(potential_album_info) albums_found.append(potential_album_info) # Search for well-known albums in the main text print(f"\nSearching for well-known albums in main text...") main_text = soup.get_text() # Known albums for these artists in the pre-1999 period known_albums = { 'Fiona Apple': [ ('Tidal', 1996) ], 'Paula Cole': [ ('Harbinger', 1994), ('This Fire', 1996) ] } if artist_name in known_albums: for album_title, expected_year in known_albums[artist_name]: # Look for mentions of these known albums if album_title.lower() in main_text.lower() and str(expected_year) in main_text: # Check if we already found this album in tables already_found = False for existing_album in artist_albums: existing_titles = [t.lower() for t in existing_album['potential_titles']] if album_title.lower() in existing_titles: already_found = True break if not already_found: print(f" Found known album in text: {album_title} ({expected_year})") text_album = { 'artist': artist_name, 'table_index': 0, # Text source 'row_index': 0, 'years_found': [expected_year], 'cell_data': [album_title, str(expected_year)], 'full_text': f'{album_title} {expected_year}', 'is_studio_album': True, 'is_live_album': False, 'is_compilation': False, 'potential_titles': [album_title] } artist_albums.append(text_album) albums_found.append(text_album) print(f"\nTotal albums found for {artist_name}: {len(artist_albums)}") for album in artist_albums: album_title = album['potential_titles'][0] if album['potential_titles'] else 'Unknown' album_year = min(album['years_found']) if album['years_found'] else 'Unknown year' print(f" - {album_title} ({album_year})") print(f"\n{'='*60}") print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ALBUM EXTRACTION RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Total albums found across both artists: {len(albums_found)}") # Process and clean up the album data processed_albums = [] for album in albums_found: year = min(album['years_found']) if album['years_found'] else None title = album['potential_titles'][0] if album['potential_titles'] else 'Title needs verification' # Clean up title title = title.strip() # Remove surrounding quotes if present if (title.startswith('"') and title.endswith('"')) or (title.startswith("'") and title.endswith("'")): title = title[1:-1] processed_album = { 'artist': album['artist'], 'title': title, 'year': year, 'all_potential_titles': album['potential_titles'], 'source_table': album['table_index'], 'source_row': album['row_index'], 'classification_confidence': 'high' if album['is_studio_album'] else 'medium', 'raw_data': album['cell_data'] } processed_albums.append(processed_album) # Sort albums by artist and year processed_albums.sort(key=lambda x: (x['artist'], x['year'] or 0)) print("=== PROCESSED ALBUMS LIST ===\n") current_artist = None for album in processed_albums: if album['artist'] != current_artist: current_artist = album['artist'] print(f"\n{current_artist}:") print("-" * len(current_artist)) confidence_indicator = "ðŸŸ¢" if album['classification_confidence'] == 'high' else "ðŸŸ¡" year_display = album['year'] if album['year'] else 'Year TBD' print(f"{confidence_indicator} {year_display}: {album['title']}") if len(album['all_potential_titles']) > 1: other_titles = [t for t in album['all_potential_titles'] if t != album['title']] print(f" Alt titles: {', '.join(other_titles)}") # Create final structured results final_results = { 'research_objective': 'Albums by Fiona Apple and Paula Cole released before 1999', 'research_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'artists_researched': list(target_artists.keys()), 'total_albums_found': len(processed_albums), 'albums_by_artist': {}, 'complete_album_list': processed_albums, 'methodology': { 'sources': 'Wikipedia discography sections and tables', 'year_filter': 'Released before 1999 (1990-1998)', 'album_types': 'Studio albums and major releases', 'extraction_method': 'HTML table parsing with known album verification' } } # Group albums by artist for album in processed_albums: artist = album['artist'] if artist not in final_results['albums_by_artist']: final_results['albums_by_artist'][artist] = [] final_results['albums_by_artist'][artist].append({ 'title': album['title'], 'year': album['year'], 'confidence': album['classification_confidence'] }) # Save results to workspace with open('workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_albums_pre_1999.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== RESEARCH SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Artists researched: {', '.join(target_artists.keys())}") print(f"Total albums found: {len(processed_albums)}") print(f"Time period: Before 1999 (1990-1998)") print(f"Focus: Studio albums and major releases") for artist, albums in final_results['albums_by_artist'].items(): print(f"\n{artist}: {len(albums)} albums") for album in albums: print(f" â€¢ {album['year']}: {album['title']} ({album['confidence']} confidence)") print(f"\nResults saved to: workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_albums_pre_1999.json") else: print("\nNo artist pages successfully downloaded. Cannot proceed with album extraction.") print(f"\n=== RESEARCH PHASE 1 COMPLETE ===") print(f"Next steps: Verify album details and enhance data quality if needed")

Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - NameError: 'page_text_lower' is not defined. The code successfully downloaded both Wikipedia pages (status 200) but crashed during content analysis due to a persistent variable naming inconsistency. Despite multiple fix attempts in **HISTORY**, the same NameError continues to occur because there's still a mismatch between variable definition and usage. Looking at the **CURRENT CODE OUTPUT**, both artists' pages were accessed successfully, but the error occurs during the content analysis phase where 'page_text_lower' is referenced but not properly defined. **PLAN** alignment: 10% - successful downloads but 0% album extraction due to the variable error preventing any album research from proceeding. The **PLAN** requires comprehensive album research with structured data output, but this basic variable scoping issue blocks all subsequent analysis. Recommended fix: Carefully review the entire code for ALL references to page text variables and ensure complete consistency - define 'page_text_lower' properly before any usage, or systematically rename all references to match the actual variable definition. This is a critical blocking issue that must be resolved before any album research can begin.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from datetime import datetime # Create workspace directory if it doesn't exist if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE ALBUM RESEARCH (PRE-1999) ===") print("Objective: Find all albums released by both artists before 1999") print("Focus: Studio albums and major releases with critical recognition\n") # Set up headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Target artists and their Wikipedia pages target_artists = { 'Fiona Apple': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple', 'Paula Cole': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Cole' } print("Step 1: Accessing Wikipedia pages for both artists...\n") # Store results for each artist successful_downloads = [] failed_downloads = [] # Download Wikipedia pages for each artist for artist_name, wikipedia_url in target_artists.items(): print(f"Accessing {artist_name}'s Wikipedia page...") print(f"URL: {wikipedia_url}") try: response = requests.get(wikipedia_url, headers=headers, timeout=20) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: print(f"âœ“ Successfully accessed {artist_name}'s page") # Save the HTML content filename = f"{artist_name.lower().replace(' ', '_')}_wikipedia.html" filepath = f'workspace/{filename}' with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) # FIXED: Simple and consistent content analysis soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') title_element = soup.find('title') page_title = title_element.get_text().strip() if title_element else 'No title found' # Get page text content - CONSISTENT NAMING full_page_text = soup.get_text() lowercase_text = full_page_text.lower() # Look for discography/album related content album_keywords = ['discography', 'album', 'studio album', 'debut', 'released'] has_album_content = any(keyword in lowercase_text for keyword in album_keywords) # Look for years in our target range (before 1999) target_years_found = [] for year in range(1990, 1999): if str(year) in full_page_text: target_years_found.append(str(year)) artist_info = { 'name': artist_name, 'wikipedia_url': wikipedia_url, 'title': page_title, 'filename': filepath, 'has_discography_info': has_album_content, 'content_length': len(response.text), 'target_years_found': target_years_found } successful_downloads.append(artist_info) print(f" Title: {page_title}") print(f" Content length: {len(response.text):,} characters") print(f" Contains discography info: {has_album_content}") print(f" Pre-1999 years found: {target_years_found}") else: failed_downloads.append({'artist': artist_name, 'url': wikipedia_url, 'status': response.status_code}) print(f"âœ— Failed to access {artist_name}'s page - Status: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: failed_downloads.append({'artist': artist_name, 'url': wikipedia_url, 'error': str(e)}) print(f"âœ— Error accessing {artist_name}'s page: {str(e)}") print() # Add spacing between artists time.sleep(2) # Be respectful to servers print(f"=== INITIAL ACCESS RESULTS ===") print(f"Successfully accessed: {len(successful_downloads)} artist pages") print(f"Failed to access: {len(failed_downloads)} artist pages") if failed_downloads: print("\nFailed downloads:") for failure in failed_downloads: print(f" - {failure['artist']}: {failure.get('status', failure.get('error'))}") # Analyze successful downloads for album information if successful_downloads: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING ARTIST PAGES FOR ALBUM INFORMATION ===\n") albums_found = [] for artist_info in successful_downloads: artist_name = artist_info['name'] filepath = artist_info['filename'] print(f"Analyzing {artist_name}'s Wikipedia page...") print(f"File: {filepath}") with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Look for discography sections print(f"\nSearching for discography sections...") discography_sections = [] headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) for heading in headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().lower() if any(word in heading_text for word in ['discography', 'albums', 'studio albums', 'career']): discography_sections.append({ 'heading': heading.get_text().strip(), 'level': heading.name, 'element': heading }) print(f"Found {len(discography_sections)} discography-related sections:") for section in discography_sections: print(f" - {section['level'].upper()}: {section['heading']}") # Look for tables that might contain album information print(f"\nAnalyzing tables for album data...") tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Found {len(tables)} tables in the page") album_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(tables): table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Check if table contains album/year information has_pre_1999_years = False for year in range(1990, 1999): if str(year) in table_text: has_pre_1999_years = True break has_album_indicators = any(word in table_text for word in ['album', 'title', 'year', 'studio', 'released', 'debut']) if has_pre_1999_years and has_album_indicators: album_tables.append({ 'index': i, 'element': table, 'has_target_years': has_pre_1999_years }) print(f" Table {i+1}: Contains album/year data - *** POTENTIAL DISCOGRAPHY TABLE ***") # Extract table headers for analysis table_headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in table_headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts}") else: print(f" Table {i+1}: General content") # Extract album information from promising tables print(f"\nExtracting album data from {len(album_tables)} potential album tables...") artist_albums = [] for table_info in album_tables: table = table_info['element'] table_index = table_info['index'] print(f"\n Processing Table {table_index + 1}:") rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Total rows: {len(rows)}") # Process each row to extract album information for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows[1:], 1): # Skip header row cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) if len(cells) >= 2: # Need at least 2 columns for meaningful data cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts) # Look for years in our target range (1990-1998) target_years_in_row = [] for year in range(1990, 1999): if str(year) in row_text: target_years_in_row.append(year) if target_years_in_row: print(f"\n Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Try to identify album title and type potential_album_info = { 'artist': artist_name, 'table_index': table_index + 1, 'row_index': row_idx, 'years_found': target_years_in_row, 'cell_data': cell_texts, 'full_text': row_text } # Determine if this is a studio album row_text_lower = row_text.lower() studio_indicators = ['studio album', 'album', 'debut album', 'lp'] live_indicators = ['live', 'concert', 'tour'] compilation_indicators = ['compilation', 'greatest hits', 'best of', 'collection'] is_studio_album = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in studio_indicators) is_live_album = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in live_indicators) is_compilation = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in compilation_indicators) # Extract album title candidates potential_titles = [] for cell_text in cell_texts: # Skip cells that are just years, very short, or contain only numbers/dates cell_clean = cell_text.strip() if (len(cell_clean) > 4 and cell_clean not in [str(y) for y in range(1990, 1999)] and not cell_clean.isdigit() and '/' not in cell_clean and not cell_clean.startswith('19')): potential_titles.append(cell_clean) potential_album_info.update({ 'is_studio_album': is_studio_album, 'is_live_album': is_live_album, 'is_compilation': is_compilation, 'potential_titles': potential_titles }) print(f" Years: {target_years_in_row}") print(f" Potential titles: {potential_titles}") print(f" Studio album: {is_studio_album}") print(f" Live album: {is_live_album}") print(f" Compilation: {is_compilation}") # Filter for studio albums and major releases if (is_studio_album or (not is_live_album and not is_compilation and len(potential_titles) > 0)): print(f" *** IDENTIFIED AS ALBUM ***") artist_albums.append(potential_album_info) albums_found.append(potential_album_info) # Search for well-known albums in the main text print(f"\nSearching for well-known albums in main text...") main_text = soup.get_text() # Known albums for these artists in the pre-1999 period known_albums = { 'Fiona Apple': [ ('Tidal', 1996) ], 'Paula Cole': [ ('Harbinger', 1994), ('This Fire', 1996) ] } if artist_name in known_albums: for album_title, expected_year in known_albums[artist_name]: # Look for mentions of these known albums if album_title.lower() in main_text.lower() and str(expected_year) in main_text: # Check if we already found this album in tables already_found = False for existing_album in artist_albums: existing_titles = [t.lower() for t in existing_album['potential_titles']] if album_title.lower() in existing_titles: already_found = True break if not already_found: print(f" Found known album in text: {album_title} ({expected_year})") text_album = { 'artist': artist_name, 'table_index': 0, # Text source 'row_index': 0, 'years_found': [expected_year], 'cell_data': [album_title, str(expected_year)], 'full_text': f'{album_title} {expected_year}', 'is_studio_album': True, 'is_live_album': False, 'is_compilation': False, 'potential_titles': [album_title] } artist_albums.append(text_album) albums_found.append(text_album) print(f"\nTotal albums found for {artist_name}: {len(artist_albums)}") for album in artist_albums: album_title = album['potential_titles'][0] if album['potential_titles'] else 'Unknown' album_year = min(album['years_found']) if album['years_found'] else 'Unknown year' print(f" - {album_title} ({album_year})") print(f"\n{'='*60}") print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ALBUM EXTRACTION RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Total albums found across both artists: {len(albums_found)}") # Process and clean up the album data processed_albums = [] for album in albums_found: year = min(album['years_found']) if album['years_found'] else None title = album['potential_titles'][0] if album['potential_titles'] else 'Title needs verification' # Clean up title title = title.strip() # Remove surrounding quotes if present if (title.startswith('"') and title.endswith('"')) or (title.startswith("'") and title.endswith("'")): title = title[1:-1] processed_album = { 'artist': album['artist'], 'title': title, 'year': year, 'all_potential_titles': album['potential_titles'], 'source_table': album['table_index'], 'source_row': album['row_index'], 'classification_confidence': 'high' if album['is_studio_album'] else 'medium', 'raw_data': album['cell_data'] } processed_albums.append(processed_album) # Sort albums by artist and year processed_albums.sort(key=lambda x: (x['artist'], x['year'] or 0)) print("=== PROCESSED ALBUMS LIST ===\n") current_artist = None for album in processed_albums: if album['artist'] != current_artist: current_artist = album['artist'] print(f"\n{current_artist}:") print("-" * len(current_artist)) confidence_indicator = "ðŸŸ¢" if album['classification_confidence'] == 'high' else "ðŸŸ¡" year_display = album['year'] if album['year'] else 'Year TBD' print(f"{confidence_indicator} {year_display}: {album['title']}") if len(album['all_potential_titles']) > 1: other_titles = [t for t in album['all_potential_titles'] if t != album['title']] print(f" Alt titles: {', '.join(other_titles)}") # Create final structured results final_results = { 'research_objective': 'Albums by Fiona Apple and Paula Cole released before 1999', 'research_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'artists_researched': list(target_artists.keys()), 'total_albums_found': len(processed_albums), 'albums_by_artist': {}, 'complete_album_list': processed_albums, 'methodology': { 'sources': 'Wikipedia discography sections and tables', 'year_filter': 'Released before 1999 (1990-1998)', 'album_types': 'Studio albums and major releases', 'extraction_method': 'HTML table parsing with known album verification' } } # Group albums by artist for album in processed_albums: artist = album['artist'] if artist not in final_results['albums_by_artist']: final_results['albums_by_artist'][artist] = [] final_results['albums_by_artist'][artist].append({ 'title': album['title'], 'year': album['year'], 'confidence': album['classification_confidence'] }) # Save results to workspace with open('workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_albums_pre_1999.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== RESEARCH SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Artists researched: {', '.join(target_artists.keys())}") print(f"Total albums found: {len(processed_albums)}") print(f"Time period: Before 1999 (1990-1998)") print(f"Focus: Studio albums and major releases") for artist, albums in final_results['albums_by_artist'].items(): print(f"\n{artist}: {len(albums)} albums") for album in albums: print(f" â€¢ {album['year']}: {album['title']} ({album['confidence']} confidence)") print(f"\nResults saved to: workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_albums_pre_1999.json") else: print("\nNo artist pages successfully downloaded. Cannot proceed with album extraction.") print(f"\n=== RESEARCH PHASE 1 COMPLETE ===") print(f"Next steps: Verify album details and enhance data quality if needed")
Execution Output
Code Output: === FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE ALBUM RESEARCH (PRE-1999) === Objective: Find all albums released by both artists before 1999 Focus: Studio albums and major releases with critical recognition Step 1: Accessing Wikipedia pages for both artists... Accessing Fiona Apple's Wikipedia page... URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple Response status: 200 âœ“ Successfully accessed Fiona Apple's page âœ— Error accessing Fiona Apple's page: name 'lowercase_text' is not defined Accessing Paula Cole's Wikipedia page... URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Cole Response status: 200 âœ“ Successfully accessed Paula Cole's page âœ— Error accessing Paula Cole's page: name 'lowercase_text' is not defined === INITIAL ACCESS RESULTS === Successfully accessed: 0 artist pages Failed to access: 2 artist pages Failed downloads: - Fiona Apple: name 'lowercase_text' is not defined - Paula Cole: name 'lowercase_text' is not defined No artist pages successfully downloaded. Cannot proceed with album extraction. === RESEARCH PHASE 1 COMPLETE === Next steps: Verify album details and enhance data quality if needed

2025-08-03 04:49:44
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 11)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from datetime import datetime # Create workspace directory if it doesn't exist if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE ALBUM RESEARCH (PRE-1999) ===") print("Objective: Find all albums released by both artists before 1999") print("Focus: Studio albums and major releases with critical recognition\n") # Set up headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Target artists and their Wikipedia pages target_artists = { 'Fiona Apple': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple', 'Paula Cole': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Cole' } print("Step 1: Accessing Wikipedia pages for both artists...\n") # Store results for each artist successful_downloads = [] failed_downloads = [] # Download Wikipedia pages for each artist for artist_name, wikipedia_url in target_artists.items(): print(f"Accessing {artist_name}'s Wikipedia page...") print(f"URL: {wikipedia_url}") try: response = requests.get(wikipedia_url, headers=headers, timeout=20) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: print(f"âœ“ Successfully accessed {artist_name}'s page") # Save the HTML content filename = f"{artist_name.lower().replace(' ', '_')}_wikipedia.html" filepath = f'workspace/{filename}' with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) # COMPLETELY FIXED: Define ALL variables before using them soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') title_element = soup.find('title') page_title = title_element.get_text().strip() if title_element else 'No title found' # Get page text content - DEFINE BOTH VARIABLES CLEARLY full_page_text = soup.get_text() full_page_text_lower = full_page_text.lower() # Look for discography/album related content using the defined variable album_keywords = ['discography', 'album', 'studio album', 'debut', 'released'] has_album_content = any(keyword in full_page_text_lower for keyword in album_keywords) # Look for years in our target range (before 1999) target_years_found = [] for year in range(1990, 1999): if str(year) in full_page_text: target_years_found.append(str(year)) artist_info = { 'name': artist_name, 'wikipedia_url': wikipedia_url, 'title': page_title, 'filename': filepath, 'has_discography_info': has_album_content, 'content_length': len(response.text), 'target_years_found': target_years_found } successful_downloads.append(artist_info) print(f" Title: {page_title}") print(f" Content length: {len(response.text):,} characters") print(f" Contains discography info: {has_album_content}") print(f" Pre-1999 years found: {target_years_found}") else: failed_downloads.append({'artist': artist_name, 'url': wikipedia_url, 'status': response.status_code}) print(f"âœ— Failed to access {artist_name}'s page - Status: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: failed_downloads.append({'artist': artist_name, 'url': wikipedia_url, 'error': str(e)}) print(f"âœ— Error accessing {artist_name}'s page: {str(e)}") print() # Add spacing between artists time.sleep(2) # Be respectful to servers print(f"=== INITIAL ACCESS RESULTS ===") print(f"Successfully accessed: {len(successful_downloads)} artist pages") print(f"Failed to access: {len(failed_downloads)} artist pages") if failed_downloads: print("\nFailed downloads:") for failure in failed_downloads: print(f" - {failure['artist']}: {failure.get('status', failure.get('error'))}") # Analyze successful downloads for album information if successful_downloads: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING ARTIST PAGES FOR ALBUM INFORMATION ===\n") albums_found = [] for artist_info in successful_downloads: artist_name = artist_info['name'] filepath = artist_info['filename'] print(f"Analyzing {artist_name}'s Wikipedia page...") print(f"File: {filepath}") with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Look for discography sections print(f"\nSearching for discography sections...") discography_sections = [] headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) for heading in headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().lower() if any(word in heading_text for word in ['discography', 'albums', 'studio albums', 'career']): discography_sections.append({ 'heading': heading.get_text().strip(), 'level': heading.name, 'element': heading }) print(f"Found {len(discography_sections)} discography-related sections:") for section in discography_sections: print(f" - {section['level'].upper()}: {section['heading']}") # Look for tables that might contain album information print(f"\nAnalyzing tables for album data...") tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Found {len(tables)} tables in the page") album_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(tables): table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Check if table contains album/year information has_pre_1999_years = False for year in range(1990, 1999): if str(year) in table_text: has_pre_1999_years = True break has_album_indicators = any(word in table_text for word in ['album', 'title', 'year', 'studio', 'released', 'debut']) if has_pre_1999_years and has_album_indicators: album_tables.append({ 'index': i, 'element': table, 'has_target_years': has_pre_1999_years }) print(f" Table {i+1}: Contains album/year data - *** POTENTIAL DISCOGRAPHY TABLE ***") # Extract table headers for analysis table_headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in table_headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts}") else: print(f" Table {i+1}: General content") # Extract album information from promising tables print(f"\nExtracting album data from {len(album_tables)} potential album tables...") artist_albums = [] for table_info in album_tables: table = table_info['element'] table_index = table_info['index'] print(f"\n Processing Table {table_index + 1}:") rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Total rows: {len(rows)}") # Process each row to extract album information for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows[1:], 1): # Skip header row cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) if len(cells) >= 2: # Need at least 2 columns for meaningful data cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts) # Look for years in our target range (1990-1998) target_years_in_row = [] for year in range(1990, 1999): if str(year) in row_text: target_years_in_row.append(year) if target_years_in_row: print(f"\n Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Try to identify album title and type potential_album_info = { 'artist': artist_name, 'table_index': table_index + 1, 'row_index': row_idx, 'years_found': target_years_in_row, 'cell_data': cell_texts, 'full_text': row_text } # Determine if this is a studio album row_text_lower = row_text.lower() studio_indicators = ['studio album', 'album', 'debut album', 'lp'] live_indicators = ['live', 'concert', 'tour'] compilation_indicators = ['compilation', 'greatest hits', 'best of', 'collection'] is_studio_album = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in studio_indicators) is_live_album = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in live_indicators) is_compilation = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in compilation_indicators) # Extract album title candidates potential_titles = [] for cell_text in cell_texts: # Skip cells that are just years, very short, or contain only numbers/dates cell_clean = cell_text.strip() if (len(cell_clean) > 4 and cell_clean not in [str(y) for y in range(1990, 1999)] and not cell_clean.isdigit() and '/' not in cell_clean and not cell_clean.startswith('19')): potential_titles.append(cell_clean) potential_album_info.update({ 'is_studio_album': is_studio_album, 'is_live_album': is_live_album, 'is_compilation': is_compilation, 'potential_titles': potential_titles }) print(f" Years: {target_years_in_row}") print(f" Potential titles: {potential_titles}") print(f" Studio album: {is_studio_album}") print(f" Live album: {is_live_album}") print(f" Compilation: {is_compilation}") # Filter for studio albums and major releases if (is_studio_album or (not is_live_album and not is_compilation and len(potential_titles) > 0)): print(f" *** IDENTIFIED AS ALBUM ***") artist_albums.append(potential_album_info) albums_found.append(potential_album_info) # Search for well-known albums in the main text print(f"\nSearching for well-known albums in main text...") main_text = soup.get_text() # Known albums for these artists in the pre-1999 period known_albums = { 'Fiona Apple': [ ('Tidal', 1996) ], 'Paula Cole': [ ('Harbinger', 1994), ('This Fire', 1996) ] } if artist_name in known_albums: for album_title, expected_year in known_albums[artist_name]: # Look for mentions of these known albums if album_title.lower() in main_text.lower() and str(expected_year) in main_text: # Check if we already found this album in tables already_found = False for existing_album in artist_albums: existing_titles = [t.lower() for t in existing_album['potential_titles']] if album_title.lower() in existing_titles: already_found = True break if not already_found: print(f" Found known album in text: {album_title} ({expected_year})") text_album = { 'artist': artist_name, 'table_index': 0, # Text source 'row_index': 0, 'years_found': [expected_year], 'cell_data': [album_title, str(expected_year)], 'full_text': f'{album_title} {expected_year}', 'is_studio_album': True, 'is_live_album': False, 'is_compilation': False, 'potential_titles': [album_title] } artist_albums.append(text_album) albums_found.append(text_album) print(f"\nTotal albums found for {artist_name}: {len(artist_albums)}") for album in artist_albums: album_title = album['potential_titles'][0] if album['potential_titles'] else 'Unknown' album_year = min(album['years_found']) if album['years_found'] else 'Unknown year' print(f" - {album_title} ({album_year})") print(f"\n{'='*60}") print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ALBUM EXTRACTION RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Total albums found across both artists: {len(albums_found)}") # Process and clean up the album data processed_albums = [] for album in albums_found: year = min(album['years_found']) if album['years_found'] else None title = album['potential_titles'][0] if album['potential_titles'] else 'Title needs verification' # Clean up title title = title.strip() # Remove surrounding quotes if present if (title.startswith('"') and title.endswith('"')) or (title.startswith("'") and title.endswith("'")): title = title[1:-1] processed_album = { 'artist': album['artist'], 'title': title, 'year': year, 'all_potential_titles': album['potential_titles'], 'source_table': album['table_index'], 'source_row': album['row_index'], 'classification_confidence': 'high' if album['is_studio_album'] else 'medium', 'raw_data': album['cell_data'] } processed_albums.append(processed_album) # Sort albums by artist and year processed_albums.sort(key=lambda x: (x['artist'], x['year'] or 0)) print("=== PROCESSED ALBUMS LIST ===\n") current_artist = None for album in processed_albums: if album['artist'] != current_artist: current_artist = album['artist'] print(f"\n{current_artist}:") print("-" * len(current_artist)) confidence_indicator = "ðŸŸ¢" if album['classification_confidence'] == 'high' else "ðŸŸ¡" year_display = album['year'] if album['year'] else 'Year TBD' print(f"{confidence_indicator} {year_display}: {album['title']}") if len(album['all_potential_titles']) > 1: other_titles = [t for t in album['all_potential_titles'] if t != album['title']] print(f" Alt titles: {', '.join(other_titles)}") # Create final structured results final_results = { 'research_objective': 'Albums by Fiona Apple and Paula Cole released before 1999', 'research_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'artists_researched': list(target_artists.keys()), 'total_albums_found': len(processed_albums), 'albums_by_artist': {}, 'complete_album_list': processed_albums, 'methodology': { 'sources': 'Wikipedia discography sections and tables', 'year_filter': 'Released before 1999 (1990-1998)', 'album_types': 'Studio albums and major releases', 'extraction_method': 'HTML table parsing with known album verification' } } # Group albums by artist for album in processed_albums: artist = album['artist'] if artist not in final_results['albums_by_artist']: final_results['albums_by_artist'][artist] = [] final_results['albums_by_artist'][artist].append({ 'title': album['title'], 'year': album['year'], 'confidence': album['classification_confidence'] }) # Save results to workspace with open('workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_albums_pre_1999.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== RESEARCH SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Artists researched: {', '.join(target_artists.keys())}") print(f"Total albums found: {len(processed_albums)}") print(f"Time period: Before 1999 (1990-1998)") print(f"Focus: Studio albums and major releases") for artist, albums in final_results['albums_by_artist'].items(): print(f"\n{artist}: {len(albums)} albums") for album in albums: print(f" â€¢ {album['year']}: {album['title']} ({album['confidence']} confidence)") print(f"\nResults saved to: workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_albums_pre_1999.json") else: print("\nNo artist pages successfully downloaded. Cannot proceed with album extraction.") print(f"\n=== RESEARCH PHASE 1 COMPLETE ===") print(f"Next steps: Verify album details and enhance data quality if needed")
Execution Output
Code Output: === FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE ALBUM RESEARCH (PRE-1999) === Objective: Find all albums released by both artists before 1999 Focus: Studio albums and major releases with critical recognition Step 1: Accessing Wikipedia pages for both artists... Accessing Fiona Apple's Wikipedia page... URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple Response status: 200 âœ“ Successfully accessed Fiona Apple's page âœ— Error accessing Fiona Apple's page: name 'full_page_text_lower' is not defined Accessing Paula Cole's Wikipedia page... URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Cole [WORKSPACE] Using task-specific workspace: workspace_d700d50d-c707-4dca-90dc-4528cddd0c80
tester
2025-08-03 04:49:44
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - NameError: 'lowercase_text' is not defined. The code successfully downloaded both Wikipedia pages (status 200) but crashed during content analysis due to a variable naming inconsistency. Looking at the **CURRENT CODE**, the issue is that 'lowercase_text' is defined on line 63 but the code on line 66 references 'page_text_lower' instead. This creates a mismatch where the variable is defined with one name but referenced with another. **PLAN** alignment: 10% - successful downloads but 0% album extraction due to the variable error blocking all subsequent analysis. The **PLAN** requires comprehensive album research with structured data output for both Fiona Apple and Paula Cole before 1999, but this naming inconsistency stops execution before any album data can be extracted. Despite multiple attempts in **HISTORY**, the same type of variable naming error persists. Recommended fix: Either (1) change line 66 to use 'lowercase_text' to match the definition, or (2) change line 63 to define 'page_text_lower' to match the usage. Complete consistency in variable naming is essential for the album research to proceed.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from datetime import datetime # Create workspace directory if it doesn't exist if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== FIONA APPLE & PAULA COLE ALBUM RESEARCH (PRE-1999) ===") print("Objective: Find all albums released by both artists before 1999") print("Focus: Studio albums and major releases with critical recognition\n") # Set up headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Target artists and their Wikipedia pages target_artists = { 'Fiona Apple': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiona_Apple', 'Paula Cole': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Cole' } print("Step 1: Accessing Wikipedia pages for both artists...\n") # Store results for each artist successful_downloads = [] failed_downloads = [] # Download Wikipedia pages for each artist for artist_name, wikipedia_url in target_artists.items(): print(f"Accessing {artist_name}'s Wikipedia page...") print(f"URL: {wikipedia_url}") try: response = requests.get(wikipedia_url, headers=headers, timeout=20) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: print(f"âœ“ Successfully accessed {artist_name}'s page") # Save the HTML content filename = f"{artist_name.lower().replace(' ', '_')}_wikipedia.html" filepath = f'workspace/{filename}' with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) # COMPLETELY FIXED: Define ALL variables before using them soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') title_element = soup.find('title') page_title = title_element.get_text().strip() if title_element else 'No title found' # Get page text content - DEFINE BOTH VARIABLES CLEARLY full_page_text = soup.get_text() full_page_text_lower = full_page_text.lower() # Look for discography/album related content using the defined variable album_keywords = ['discography', 'album', 'studio album', 'debut', 'released'] has_album_content = any(keyword in full_page_text_lower for keyword in album_keywords) # Look for years in our target range (before 1999) target_years_found = [] for year in range(1990, 1999): if str(year) in full_page_text: target_years_found.append(str(year)) artist_info = { 'name': artist_name, 'wikipedia_url': wikipedia_url, 'title': page_title, 'filename': filepath, 'has_discography_info': has_album_content, 'content_length': len(response.text), 'target_years_found': target_years_found } successful_downloads.append(artist_info) print(f" Title: {page_title}") print(f" Content length: {len(response.text):,} characters") print(f" Contains discography info: {has_album_content}") print(f" Pre-1999 years found: {target_years_found}") else: failed_downloads.append({'artist': artist_name, 'url': wikipedia_url, 'status': response.status_code}) print(f"âœ— Failed to access {artist_name}'s page - Status: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: failed_downloads.append({'artist': artist_name, 'url': wikipedia_url, 'error': str(e)}) print(f"âœ— Error accessing {artist_name}'s page: {str(e)}") print() # Add spacing between artists time.sleep(2) # Be respectful to servers print(f"=== INITIAL ACCESS RESULTS ===") print(f"Successfully accessed: {len(successful_downloads)} artist pages") print(f"Failed to access: {len(failed_downloads)} artist pages") if failed_downloads: print("\nFailed downloads:") for failure in failed_downloads: print(f" - {failure['artist']}: {failure.get('status', failure.get('error'))}") # Analyze successful downloads for album information if successful_downloads: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING ARTIST PAGES FOR ALBUM INFORMATION ===\n") albums_found = [] for artist_info in successful_downloads: artist_name = artist_info['name'] filepath = artist_info['filename'] print(f"Analyzing {artist_name}'s Wikipedia page...") print(f"File: {filepath}") with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Look for discography sections print(f"\nSearching for discography sections...") discography_sections = [] headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) for heading in headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().lower() if any(word in heading_text for word in ['discography', 'albums', 'studio albums', 'career']): discography_sections.append({ 'heading': heading.get_text().strip(), 'level': heading.name, 'element': heading }) print(f"Found {len(discography_sections)} discography-related sections:") for section in discography_sections: print(f" - {section['level'].upper()}: {section['heading']}") # Look for tables that might contain album information print(f"\nAnalyzing tables for album data...") tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Found {len(tables)} tables in the page") album_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(tables): table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Check if table contains album/year information has_pre_1999_years = False for year in range(1990, 1999): if str(year) in table_text: has_pre_1999_years = True break has_album_indicators = any(word in table_text for word in ['album', 'title', 'year', 'studio', 'released', 'debut']) if has_pre_1999_years and has_album_indicators: album_tables.append({ 'index': i, 'element': table, 'has_target_years': has_pre_1999_years }) print(f" Table {i+1}: Contains album/year data - *** POTENTIAL DISCOGRAPHY TABLE ***") # Extract table headers for analysis table_headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in table_headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts}") else: print(f" Table {i+1}: General content") # Extract album information from promising tables print(f"\nExtracting album data from {len(album_tables)} potential album tables...") artist_albums = [] for table_info in album_tables: table = table_info['element'] table_index = table_info['index'] print(f"\n Processing Table {table_index + 1}:") rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Total rows: {len(rows)}") # Process each row to extract album information for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows[1:], 1): # Skip header row cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) if len(cells) >= 2: # Need at least 2 columns for meaningful data cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts) # Look for years in our target range (1990-1998) target_years_in_row = [] for year in range(1990, 1999): if str(year) in row_text: target_years_in_row.append(year) if target_years_in_row: print(f"\n Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Try to identify album title and type potential_album_info = { 'artist': artist_name, 'table_index': table_index + 1, 'row_index': row_idx, 'years_found': target_years_in_row, 'cell_data': cell_texts, 'full_text': row_text } # Determine if this is a studio album row_text_lower = row_text.lower() studio_indicators = ['studio album', 'album', 'debut album', 'lp'] live_indicators = ['live', 'concert', 'tour'] compilation_indicators = ['compilation', 'greatest hits', 'best of', 'collection'] is_studio_album = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in studio_indicators) is_live_album = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in live_indicators) is_compilation = any(indicator in row_text_lower for indicator in compilation_indicators) # Extract album title candidates potential_titles = [] for cell_text in cell_texts: # Skip cells that are just years, very short, or contain only numbers/dates cell_clean = cell_text.strip() if (len(cell_clean) > 4 and cell_clean not in [str(y) for y in range(1990, 1999)] and not cell_clean.isdigit() and '/' not in cell_clean and not cell_clean.startswith('19')): potential_titles.append(cell_clean) potential_album_info.update({ 'is_studio_album': is_studio_album, 'is_live_album': is_live_album, 'is_compilation': is_compilation, 'potential_titles': potential_titles }) print(f" Years: {target_years_in_row}") print(f" Potential titles: {potential_titles}") print(f" Studio album: {is_studio_album}") print(f" Live album: {is_live_album}") print(f" Compilation: {is_compilation}") # Filter for studio albums and major releases if (is_studio_album or (not is_live_album and not is_compilation and len(potential_titles) > 0)): print(f" *** IDENTIFIED AS ALBUM ***") artist_albums.append(potential_album_info) albums_found.append(potential_album_info) # Search for well-known albums in the main text print(f"\nSearching for well-known albums in main text...") main_text = soup.get_text() # Known albums for these artists in the pre-1999 period known_albums = { 'Fiona Apple': [ ('Tidal', 1996) ], 'Paula Cole': [ ('Harbinger', 1994), ('This Fire', 1996) ] } if artist_name in known_albums: for album_title, expected_year in known_albums[artist_name]: # Look for mentions of these known albums if album_title.lower() in main_text.lower() and str(expected_year) in main_text: # Check if we already found this album in tables already_found = False for existing_album in artist_albums: existing_titles = [t.lower() for t in existing_album['potential_titles']] if album_title.lower() in existing_titles: already_found = True break if not already_found: print(f" Found known album in text: {album_title} ({expected_year})") text_album = { 'artist': artist_name, 'table_index': 0, # Text source 'row_index': 0, 'years_found': [expected_year], 'cell_data': [album_title, str(expected_year)], 'full_text': f'{album_title} {expected_year}', 'is_studio_album': True, 'is_live_album': False, 'is_compilation': False, 'potential_titles': [album_title] } artist_albums.append(text_album) albums_found.append(text_album) print(f"\nTotal albums found for {artist_name}: {len(artist_albums)}") for album in artist_albums: album_title = album['potential_titles'][0] if album['potential_titles'] else 'Unknown' album_year = min(album['years_found']) if album['years_found'] else 'Unknown year' print(f" - {album_title} ({album_year})") print(f"\n{'='*60}") print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ALBUM EXTRACTION RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Total albums found across both artists: {len(albums_found)}") # Process and clean up the album data processed_albums = [] for album in albums_found: year = min(album['years_found']) if album['years_found'] else None title = album['potential_titles'][0] if album['potential_titles'] else 'Title needs verification' # Clean up title title = title.strip() # Remove surrounding quotes if present if (title.startswith('"') and title.endswith('"')) or (title.startswith("'") and title.endswith("'")): title = title[1:-1] processed_album = { 'artist': album['artist'], 'title': title, 'year': year, 'all_potential_titles': album['potential_titles'], 'source_table': album['table_index'], 'source_row': album['row_index'], 'classification_confidence': 'high' if album['is_studio_album'] else 'medium', 'raw_data': album['cell_data'] } processed_albums.append(processed_album) # Sort albums by artist and year processed_albums.sort(key=lambda x: (x['artist'], x['year'] or 0)) print("=== PROCESSED ALBUMS LIST ===\n") current_artist = None for album in processed_albums: if album['artist'] != current_artist: current_artist = album['artist'] print(f"\n{current_artist}:") print("-" * len(current_artist)) confidence_indicator = "ðŸŸ¢" if album['classification_confidence'] == 'high' else "ðŸŸ¡" year_display = album['year'] if album['year'] else 'Year TBD' print(f"{confidence_indicator} {year_display}: {album['title']}") if len(album['all_potential_titles']) > 1: other_titles = [t for t in album['all_potential_titles'] if t != album['title']] print(f" Alt titles: {', '.join(other_titles)}") # Create final structured results final_results = { 'research_objective': 'Albums by Fiona Apple and Paula Cole released before 1999', 'research_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'artists_researched': list(target_artists.keys()), 'total_albums_found': len(processed_albums), 'albums_by_artist': {}, 'complete_album_list': processed_albums, 'methodology': { 'sources': 'Wikipedia discography sections and tables', 'year_filter': 'Released before 1999 (1990-1998)', 'album_types': 'Studio albums and major releases', 'extraction_method': 'HTML table parsing with known album verification' } } # Group albums by artist for album in processed_albums: artist = album['artist'] if artist not in final_results['albums_by_artist']: final_results['albums_by_artist'][artist] = [] final_results['albums_by_artist'][artist].append({ 'title': album['title'], 'year': album['year'], 'confidence': album['classification_confidence'] }) # Save results to workspace with open('workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_albums_pre_1999.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== RESEARCH SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Artists researched: {', '.join(target_artists.keys())}") print(f"Total albums found: {len(processed_albums)}") print(f"Time period: Before 1999 (1990-1998)") print(f"Focus: Studio albums and major releases") for artist, albums in final_results['albums_by_artist'].items(): print(f"\n{artist}: {len(albums)} albums") for album in albums: print(f" â€¢ {album['year']}: {album['title']} ({album['confidence']} confidence)") print(f"\nResults saved to: workspace/fiona_apple_paula_cole_albums_pre_1999.json") else: print("\nNo artist pages successfully downloaded. Cannot proceed with album extraction.") print(f"\n=== RESEARCH PHASE 1 COMPLETE ===") print(f"Next steps: Verify album details and enhance data quality if needed")
Execution Output
